docs.lead_paragraph: I've read so little about the Class Act in recent weeks that when President Obama signed the health care bill yesterday, surrounded by a gaggle of happy Democrats, I had to call the National Council on Aging to reassure myself that yes, this often overlooked but potentially transformational program remained part of the package.

headline.main: A New Long-Term Care Insurance Program

docs.abstract: The measure signed into law by President Obama on Tuesday contains a little-remarked insurance program designed to help Americans pay for long-term care.
docs.snippet: The measure signed into law by President Obama on Tuesday contains a little-remarked insurance program designed to help Americans pay for long-term care.

docs.lead_paragraph: Monologue | Tuesday night on "The Late Late Show With Craig Ferguson" on CBS: What kind of a day is it for you? Because I think it is a great day for America! It is. And I'll tell you why. Because all day today Ben & Jerry's was giving out free ice cream. And Starbucks was giving out free pastries. Everybody's getting cocky now that there's free health insurance. Eat what you like. Diabetes? Who cares?

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.
docs.abstract: Easier bankruptcy protection for people who can't repay their student loans, a new site offers travel deals for families and other consumer-focused items from Wednesday's Times.
docs.snippet: Easier bankruptcy protection for people who can't repay their student loans, a new site offers travel deals for families and other consumer-focused items from Wednesday's Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama makes good on a promise to anti-abortion Democrats Wednesday, signing an executive order in the afternoon stating that no funds from the health care overhaul may be used to finance abortions.

headline.main: The Early Word: Nukes, Banks, Abortion

docs.abstract: With health care legislation nearing its final vote, Democrats make moves on other priorities.
docs.snippet: With health care legislation nearing its final vote, Democrats make moves on other priorities.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Tuesday, President Obama signed into law a sweeping overhaul of the nation's health care system, approved by the Senate on Christmas Eve and by the House on Sunday. The House also adopted a package of changes - agreed to in negotiations among House and Senate Democrats and the White House - which is being considered by the Senate.

headline.main: How the Overhaul Will Affect You

docs.abstract: An interactive graphic shows some of the ways in which the health care overhaul will affect Americans from different walks of life.
docs.snippet: An interactive graphic shows some of the ways in which the health care overhaul will affect Americans from different walks of life.

docs.lead_paragraph: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago.

headline.main: The Housing Crisis and the Resentment Zone

docs.abstract: Means-tested government benefits, and the "resentment zone" that goes with them, are more prevalent than ever, thanks to the housing crash. Programs like these delay the housing market's recovery, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: Means-tested government benefits, and the "resentment zone" that goes with them, are more prevalent than ever, thanks to the housing crash. Programs like these delay the housing market's recovery, an economist writes.

headline.main: The Politics of the Health Overhaul
headline.print_headline: The Politics of the Health Overhaul

docs.lead_paragraph: We got health care reform. Now we need political innovation that will empower independents and centrists, which describes a lot of the country.
